questions.question: What is the cardinality of the power set of a set with 5 elements?
Which of the following is a valid proof technique for proving a statement is true for all natural numbers?
What is the solution to the recurrence relation T(n) = 2T(n/2) + n, where T(1) = 1?
What is the chromatic number of a complete graph with 6 vertices?
What is the value of the Eulerian path in the following graph?
What is the minimum number of edges required to connect n vertices in a tree?
Which of the following is a valid graph representation?
What is the difference between a graph and a digraph?
options: Digraphs have directed edges, graphs have undirected edges
Graphs are a subset of digraphs
Digraphs are a subset of graphs

questions.question: What is the relationship between a Hamiltonian cycle and a Eulerian cycle?
options: A Hamiltonian cycle must be a Eulerian cycle
A Eulerian cycle must be a Hamiltonian cycle
A Hamiltonian cycle and a Eulerian cycle are independent
A Hamiltonian cycle is a special case of a Eulerian cycle

questions.question: What is the difference between a tree and a forest?
options: A tree is a connected graph with no cycles, a forest is a disconnected graph with no cycles
A forest is a connected graph with no cycles, a tree is a disconnected graph with no cycles
A tree is a subset of a forest
A forest is a subset of a tree
